ygData.subject: Re: Twinking??
ygData.msgSnippet: I was had been playing on Bristlebane when I found out some real life friends were playing on Cazic-Thule. I switched to Cazic-Thule because I felt it was good
ygData.messageBody:
I was had been playing on Bristlebane when I found out some real life
friends were playing on Cazic-Thule. I switched to Cazic-Thule because I
felt it was good to be around some folks I knew. These fellow are guys I
know from our paper and pencil role playing group.

Anyway we made arrangements when I first made my character. My friend
brought me an entire set of cloth armour. He was a wizard so basically he
just handed me his clothing. At level 1 I had a cracked staff, then later my
friends brought me a fine steel staff. I was about level 5 then.

This mini-twinking did make it easier for me to advance. I did not die half
as many times as I had as my first bristlebane character. I was able to more
quickly save up for patchwork. A "female" player gave me a good deal on a
set of patchwork when I was level 4.

I don't think this was serious twinking. And I don't think I got the stuff
because I was "female." I think they would have given it to a friend
regardless.

Other than that, no one has given me anything. Maybe these other "females"
are asking for stuff?

By the way, one of my male friends plays a female high elf. He said he plays
her because he likes to inviso people to killl their pets and likes the
reaction he gets to his "female" self. Heh. Weird guy.


-----Original Message-----
From: Suzanne Johnson <katannah@...>
To: EQ_women@onelist.com <EQ_women@onelist.com>
Date: Friday, June 18, 1999 9:36 PM
Subject: Re: [EQ_women] Digest Number 1


>From: Suzanne Johnson <katannah@...>
>
>Grrrrrrrrr. I've been playing since Day one, and have noticed that most of
the
>guys I work with have switched to female characters, supposedly because
they get
>free stuff. I wasn't ever given (nor did I solicit any) stuff until I
joined a
>guild. Now, my brothers take care of me, but since I reciprocate, I feel
it's
>fair. Every time I see a "female" character (especially wood elves since I
play
>one) twinking, I /tell them....hehehe.......might not make me very popular
but I
>feel better at night. =)
>
>Tara Lea wrote:
>
>> From: Tara Lea <dactyl5@...>
>>
>> I was intrigued to see RPG weddings... I have a boyfriend in RL who plays
a
>> Barbarian Shaman at a higher level than myself, on the same server. So,
I
>> get some perks from that :) He normally plays from work with other
friends
>> and his brother, so it's like a close knit family. They just play the
game,
>> and that's what they are there for...hunting and quests, no on line
>> relationships. I group with all males, which proves to be interesting.
>> Flirting does take place and all members have significant others that do
not
>> play EQ... soon to be single with the way the are on all the time! I
have
>> been told most males will play female characters since they get more
things
>> and favors... I suppose I have noticed that. I love the game and find I
>> look forward to going home from work to play... it's a whole other world!
>>
>> Hope to hear from y'all.
>>
>> -Aegea
>>

>> >From: Danette Barber <shardesane@...>
>> >
>> >Hello All,
>> >
>> > I have lot of different characters, but my two main ones are Dyrlia
>> >RaverSong, a level 24 bearded Dwarven Cleric on Innoruuk server, and
>> >Dandara, a level 13 Human ShadowKnight on Cazic-Thule server.
>> >
>> > I have never been asked if I am a woman in real life, which I find
rather
>> >odd, but count my blessings for. I'm sure it will happen someday, but it
>> >hasn't so far. (Crosses fingers).
>> >
>> > As far as flirting goes, I am a notorious flirt and I'll flirt with
>> >anyone
>> >at any time. That's the way I am in real life, so I guess I can't help
it
>> >in
>> >EQ. I think human interaction is one of the best parts of the game, and
>> >flirtation is one of the oldest of human interactions <grin>. If you and
>> >those you do it with enjoy it, by all means have fun with it.
>> >
>> > The thing that irks me to no end (and I'll be honest here and admit
that
>> >I
>> >believe most of these "women" to be played by men)is the female
characters
>> >that you see once in awhile that shout something to the effect of "I'm a
>> >cute, helpless, sexy, level four wood elf and I want someone to give me,
>> >for
>> >free, an item or ten obtainable only by a full-group of level 40+
people.
>> >*bats eyelashes*." I'm not saying its wrong or that they should be
shunned
>> >on site. I'm not even sure exactly why it bothers me, but its incredibly
>> >annoying. Maybe it's because I feel like they are taking advantage of
male
>> >hormones, and I don't feel right doing that so I'm jealous <G>. Dandara
did
>> >ask someone of higher level once to bring her back an ice goblin from
>> >Permafrost, but I don't exactly see that as being the same thing.
>> >
>> >Cheers,
>> >
>> >Danette
>> >
>> >
